edu.biu.scapi.circuits.circuit

Class BooleanCircuit

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.circuits.circuit.BooleanCircuit

  • public class BooleanCircuit
extends java.lang.Object
    A software representation of a boolean circuit.

    The circuit is constructed from Wires and Gates. Once input has been set, the compute() function performs the computation and returns the computed output Wires. The equals function verifies that two gates are equivalent.

    Author:
    Steven Goldfeder

    • Constructor Detail

      • BooleanCircuit

        public BooleanCircuit(java.io.File f)
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                      CircuitFileFormatException
        Constructs a BooleanCircuit from a File.

        The File first lists the number of Gates, then the number of parties.

        Then for each party: party number, the number of inputs for that party, and following there is a list of indices of each of these input Wires.

        Next it lists the number of output Wires followed by the index of each of these Wires.

        Then for each gate, we have the following: number of inputWires, number of OutputWires inputWireIndices OutputWireIndices and the gate's truth Table (as a 0-1 string).

        example file: 1 2 1 1 1 2 1 2 1 3 2 1 1 2 3 0001

        Parameters:
        f - The File from which the circuit is read.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if f is not found in the specified directory.
        CircuitFileFormatException - if there is a problem with the format of the file.

      • BooleanCircuit

        public BooleanCircuit(java.util.Scanner s)
               throws CircuitFileFormatException
        Constructs a BooleanCircuit from a Scanner.

        The Scanner's underyling contents contains a lists the number of Gates, then the number of parties.

        Then for each party: party number, the number of inputs for that party, and following there is a list of indices of each of these input Wires.

        Next it lists the number of output Wires followed by the index of each of these Wires.

        Then for each gate, we have the following: number of inputWires, number of OutputWires inputWireIndices OutputWireIndices and the gate's truth Table (as a 0-1 string).

        example file: 1 2 1 1 1 2 1 2 1 3 2 1 1 2 3 0001

        Parameters:
        s - The Scanner from which the circuit is read.
        Throws:
        CircuitFileFormatException - if there is a problem with the format of the circuit.

      • BooleanCircuit

        public BooleanCircuit(Gate[] gates,
              int[] outputWireIndices,
              java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> eachPartysInputWires)
        Constructs a {code BooleanCircuit} from an array of gates.

        Each gate keeps an array of the indices of its input and output wires. The constructor is provided with a list of which Wires are output Wires of the BooleanCircuit.

        Parameters:
        gates - An array of Gates to create from which to construct the BooleanCircuit.
        outputWireIndices - An array containing the indices of the wires that will be output of the BooleanCircuit.
        eachPartysInputWires - An arrayList containing the indices of the input Wires of this BooleanCircuit indexed by the party number.

    • Method Detail

      • setInputs

        public void setInputs(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Wire> presetInputWires,
             int partyNumber)
               throws NoSuchPartyException
        Sets the specified party's input to the circuit from a map containing constructed and set Wires.

        It updates that this party's input has been set. Once the input is set for all parties that have input, the circuit is ready to be computed.

        Parameters:
        presetInputWires - The circuit's input wires whose values have been previously set.
        Throws:
        NoSuchPartyException - if the party number is negative or bigger then the given number of parties.

      • setInputs

        public void setInputs(java.io.File inputWires,
             int partyNumber)
               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                      InvalidInputException,
                      NoSuchPartyException
        Sets the input to the circuit by reading it from a file.

        Written in the file is a list that contains the number of input Wires followed by rows of Wire numbers and values.

        Parameters:
        inputWires - The File containing the representation of the circuit's input.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        InvalidInputException
        NoSuchPartyException

      • compute

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Wire> compute()
                                              throws NotAllInputsSetException
        Computes the circuit if the input has been set.

        Returns:
        a Map that maps the output Wire index to the computed Wire.
        Throws:
        NotAllInputsSetException - in case there is a party that has no input.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        The verify method tests the circuits for equality returning true if they are and falseif they are not.

        In order to be considered equal, Gates and Wires must be indexed identically and Gates must contain the same truth table.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - A BooleanCircuit to be tested for equality to this BooleanCircuit
        Returns:
        true if the given BooleanCircuit is equivalent to this Boolean Circuit, false otherwise.

        public Gate[] getGates()
        Returns:
        an array of the Gates of this circuit.

        public int[] getOutputWireIndices()
        Returns:
        an array of the outputWire indices of this circuit.

      • getInputWireIndices

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getInputWireIndices(int partyNumber)
                                                           throws NoSuchPartyException
        Parameters:
        partyNumber - The number of the party whose input wires will be returned.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList containing the input Wire indices of the specified party.
        Throws:
        NoSuchPartyException - if the given party number is less than 1 and greater than the given number of parties.

        Parameters:
